access: A character who is a member of the Red Mantis assassins has access to this uncommon armor.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mantis Shell](/Armor.aspx?ID=30)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Adjusted Weapon Harness" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=468" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 11 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 10 gp

**AC Bonus** +2

**Dex Cap** +3

**Check Penalty** -1

**Speed Penalty** —
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 12

**Bulk** 1

**Category** Light

**Group** Skeletal
</row>

</column>

---

Construction of mantis shell armor originates with the Red Mantis assassins. Authentic mantis shell can be found in some dark markets, but wearing such armor can attract deadly attention from the armor's originators. Mantis shell comes with the [weapon harness](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1826) adjustment, though these special vambraces are meant to hold [sawtooth sabers](/Weapons.aspx?ID=65), and attaching anything else is an insult to the Red Mantis.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-6" />
name: Mantis Shell
